title: [Large-Scale] ADDIE Model-Based Education Design for Newborn Care Preparation: Strengthening Social Responsibility

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of pregnancy and childbirth processes, general awareness of social rights and systems related to newborn care
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen pre-service/in-service teachers' practical skills and instructional design competencies for newborn care, with particular emphasis on fostering social responsibility and cultural sensitivity as citizens.

learning_goals: Learners will identify five danger signs in newborn care and explain appropriate response plans linked to social support systems.
Learners will analyze practical breastfeeding technique applications and propose effective problem-solving strategies considering cultural diversity.
Learners will design a newborn care education program following the ADDIE model phases and integrate community resource utilization plans.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
